ProxyBinder Class

Defined in: src/proxybinder.js:9

A Proxy Binder manages the external interface, and creates one of the different types of objects exposed by freedom either as a global within a worker / module context, or returned by an external call to create a freedom runtime.

  • Index
  • Methods

Item Index

Methods

  • bindDefault
  • getExternal

Methods

bindDefault

(
  • port
  • api
  • manifest
  • internal
)
Promise private

Defined in src/proxybinder.js:65

Bind the default proxy for a freedom port.

Parameters:

  • port Port

    The port for the proxy to communicate with.

  • api Api

    The API loader with API definitions.

  • manifest Object

    The manifest of the module to expose.

  • internal Boolean

    Whether the interface is for inside the module.

Returns:

Promise:

A promise for a proxy interface.

getExternal

(
  • port
  • name
  • [definition]
)
Promise

Defined in src/proxybinder.js:22

Create a proxy for a freedom port, and return it once loaded.

Parameters:

  • port Port

    The port for the proxy to communicate with.

  • name String

    The name of the proxy.

  • [definition] Object optional

    The definition of the API to expose.

    • name String

      The name of the API.

    • definition Object

      The definition of the API.

    • provides Boolean

      Whether this is a consumer or provider.

Returns:

Promise:

A promise for the active proxy interface.
